title: Archer Multi Functional Remote was built for accessibility, but perfect for dropbar wireless shifting
content:
The latest wireless shifting option from Archer Components has a fascinating backstory. While many forms of wireless shifting are designed simply to remove shift cables from the equation, the Archer MFR or Multi-Functional Remote was built with more noble intentions. The idea was to provide a remote that would allow riders with specific needs to

The post Archer Multi Functional Remote was built for accessibility, but perfect for dropbar wireless shifting appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Zach Overholt
